title: Arnie Morgan
text:
Arnold "Arnie" Morgan (born 19 September 1942) is an English former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1960s and 1970s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>, <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> and <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Yorkshire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Featherstone%20Rovers%20players">Heritage № 426</a>) and <a href="York%20Wasps">York</a>, as an occasional <a href="Goal%20%28sports%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a>-kicking or , i.e. number 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Arnie Morgan was born in <a href="Pontefract">Pontefract</a>, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a>, England, he worked a <a href="Waste%20collector">refuse collector</a> .
Playing career.
International honours.
Arnie Morgan, won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Featherstone Rovers in 1968 against Wales, and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Featherstone Rovers in 1968 against France (2 matches), and in the <a href="1968%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1968 Rugby League World Cup</a> against France, and New Zealand.
County honours.
Arnie Morgan won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Yorkshire</a> while at <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>; during the <a href="1967%E2%80%9368%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1967–68 season</a> as an <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a> against <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a>, during the <a href="1968%E2%80%9369%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1968–69 season</a> against <a href="Cumberland%20rugby%20league%20team">Cumberland</a> and <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Lancashire</a>, and during the <a href="1969%E2%80%9370%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1969–70 season</a> as an <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a> against Lancashire.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Arnie Morgan played left-, i.e. number 11, and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>' 17-12 victory over <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a> in the <a href="1966%E2%80%9367%20Challenge%20Cup">1966–67</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1966%E2%80%9367%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1966–67 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 13 May 1967, in front of a crowd of 76,290.
County Cup Final appearances.
Arnie Morgan played left-, i.e. number 11, in <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>' 12-25 defeat by <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="1966%E2%80%9367%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1966–67</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1966%E2%80%9367%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1966–67 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 15 October 1966, and played left- in the 9-12 defeat by <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> in the <a href="1969%E2%80%9370%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1969–70</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1969%E2%80%9370%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1969–70 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 20 September 1969.
Club career.
Arnie Morgan made his début for Featherstone Rovers on Saturday 17 February 1962, he appears to have scored no drop-goals (or field-goals as they are currently known in Australasia), but prior to the <a href="1974%E2%80%9375%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1974–75 season</a> all goals, whether; <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">conversion</a>s, <a href="Penalty%20%28rugby%29%23Penalties%20in%20rugby%20league">penalties</a>, or <a href="Drop%20goal%23Rugby%20league">drop-goal</a>s, scored 2-points, consequently prior to this date drop-goals were often not explicitly documented, therefore '0' drop-goals may indicate drop-goals not recorded, rather than no drop-goals scored.
Testimonial match.
Arnie Morgan's <a href="Benefit%20%28sports%29">benefit</a> <a href="Benefit%20season">season</a>/<a href="testimonial%20match">testimonial match</a> at <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> took place during the <a href="1971%E2%80%9372%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1971–72 season</a>.
Honoured at Featherstone Rovers.
Arnie Morgan is a Featherstone Rovers Hall of Fame inductee.
Genealogical information.
Arnie Morgan is the son of Albert Morgan and Violet (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Barker), the younger brother of Brian Morgan, the grandson of the rugby league footballer for <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>, <a href="Joseph%20Morgan%20%28rugby%20league%29">Joseph</a> <a href="Joe%20Morgan%20%28rugby%20league%29">"Joe" Morgan</a> (Heritage № 26), the great-nephew of Joseph "Joe" Morgan's brothers, the rugby league footballers for <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>, the brothers; <a href="Thomas%20Morgan%20%28rugby%20league%29">Thomas</a> <a href="Tom%20Morgan%20%28rugby%20league%29">"Tom"</a>/<a href="Tommy%20Morgan%20%28rugby%20league%29">"Tommy" Morgan</a> (Heritage № 79), and <a href="Luke%20Morgan%20%28rugby%20league%29">Luke Morgan</a> (Heritage № 90), and the cousin of the rugby league footballers for <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>; <a href="Denis%20Morgan">Denis</a>/<a href="Dennis%20Morgan%20%28rugby%20league%29">Dennis Morgan</a> (Heritage № 425), and <a href="Mick%20Morgan">Mick Morgan</a>.
